The effective date of the compensation plan.  It is recommended to use 1900-01-01.

Eligibility Rules to establish who is eligible for this compensation component.  If you select multiple eligibility rules, Workday evaluates each rule independently to determine employee eligibility for the compensation component. Employees are eligible if they meet the qualifications of any one rule.

Eligibility Rules to establish who is eligible for coverage dates for this compensation component. If you select multiple eligibility rules, Workday evaluates each rule independently to determine employee eligibility for the compensation component. Employees are eligible if they meet the qualifications of any one rule.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

When setting up the bonus process for the bonus plan, Workday displays the bonus pool based on the matrix side-by-side with the bonus pool, which reflects the budget from an executive level. You can then compare the two pools to figure out whether the money you've received to fund the bonus event can cover the published matrix requirements, or whether the guidelines exceed the allowed budget.
Indicates that Net Attainment is an input to employee bonus targets.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Performance Factor Scorecard Data is part of Performance Factors Data within a Bonus Plan.  There must be at least one Performance Factor Scorecard Data within the Performance Factors Data.

Indicates that Net Attainment is an input to employee bonus targets.
The total weight between all compensation matrices and scorecards must total 100 percent.

This is a wrapper for the Compensation Tranche Replacement Data which is used to display and replace Compensation Tranche Data within Bonus Plan; it is optional.

This is optional for single target bonus plans so that you have the option to create a bonus plan without using it to budget for bonuses. The default, however, is required for all bonus plans that use multiple targets.
This is a wrapper for the Bonus Plan Amount; this is used to display or replace Amount Plan Profile Data; it is required and mutually exclusive with Bonus Plan Percentage.

No Individual Override indicator prevents default values from being overridden for specific employees assigned to an Allowance Plan; if the value is True, then Amount, Percent, or Unit Data is required for Amount, Percent, and Unit Allowance Plans respectively.
If not selected, assignment amounts are to be entered as the flat amount to be paid to the employee. Workday will divide the assigned amount by the ~employee’s~ FTE for 100% FTE calculations.

Will create a Dynamic Calculated Plan if selected. Purely informational and cannot be used to change plan type once plans are created.
Will create an Event Driven Calculated Plan if selected. Purely informational and cannot be used to change plan type once plans are created.
Select Y to exclude the calculated plan from Total Salary and Allowances compensation basis, or N to include the calculated plan in the Total Salary and Allowances compensation basis.
Overrides the plan type name for the calculated plan.

Plan Type Reference elements are used to limit the compensation plans returned by a type.  The ID identifier attribute is "Compensation_Plan_Type_ID".  The supported type values are BONUS, FUTURE.. Supports multiple values.

Plan Type Reference elements are used to limit the compensation plans returned by a type.  The ID identifier attribute is "Compensation_Plan_Type_ID".  The supported type values are BONUS, FUTURE.. Supports multiple values.
Include Inactive indicates the response will also include inactive Compensation Plans and Guideline components.

Coverage_Date_Eligibility_Reference.description: Eligibility Rules to establish who is eligible for coverage dates for this compensation component. If you select multiple eligibility rules, Workday evaluates each rule independently to determine employee eligibility for the compensation component. Employees are eligible if they meet the qualifications of any one rule.

Description.description: Unique attribute name/description identifying a valid instance of Compensation Plan.

Draw_Amount.description: The Draw Amount, Draw Frequency, and Draw Duration are for informational purposes and passing to a third-party commission system.

Draw_Duration.description: The Draw Amount, Draw Frequency, and Draw Duration are for informational purposes and passing to a third-party commission system.

Effective_Date.description: The effective date of the compensation plan.  It is recommended to use 1900-01-01.

Eligibility_Rule_Reference.description: Eligibility Rules to establish who is eligible for this compensation component.  If you select multiple eligibility rules, Workday evaluates each rule independently to determine employee eligibility for the compensation component. Employees are eligible if they meet the qualifications of any one rule.

Exclude_from_Total_Salary_and_Allowance_.description: Select Y to exclude the calculated plan from Total Salary and Allowances compensation basis, or N to include the calculated plan in the Total Salary and Allowances compensation basis.

Include_Inactive_Prompt.description: Include Inactive indicates the response will also include inactive Compensation Plans and Guideline components.

Merit_Plan_Include_Active_Employees_Assi.description: If selected, employees assigned this plan at any time during the process period are included in the process.

Merit_Plan_Include_Active_Employees_in_W.description: When this box is checked, employees in a waiting period will be included in a process and will appear with a default target of zero.

Minimum_Wage.description: Minimum wage indicator for the Hourly Plan Compensation data.

Percent_Manage_By_Compensation_Basis_Rul.description: Indicates if Merit Amounts will be managed by the Compensation Basis Rules.

Percent_Plan_Profile_Replacement_Data.description: Used to display or replace Percent Plan Profile Data for a Percent Bonus Plan.

Performance_Factor_Scorecard_Data.description: Performance Factor Scorecard Data is part of Performance Factors Data within a Bonus Plan.  There must be at least one Performance Factor Scorecard Data within the Performance Factors Data.

Plan_Type_Name_Override.description: Overrides the plan type name for the calculated plan.

Plan_Type_Reference_Compensation_Plan_Ty.description: Plan Type Reference elements are used to limit the compensation plans returned by a type.  The ID identifier attribute is "Compensation_Plan_Type_ID".  The supported type values are BONUS, FUTURE.. Supports multiple values.

Plan_Type_Reference_WID_Prompt.description: Plan Type Reference elements are used to limit the compensation plans returned by a type.  The ID identifier attribute is "Compensation_Plan_Type_ID".  The supported type values are BONUS, FUTURE.. Supports multiple values.

Recoverable.description: Indicates whether commission payments made for this plan are Recoverable by default.

Salary_Apply_Full_Time_Equivalent.description: If not selected, assignment amounts are to be entered as the flat amount to be paid to the employee. Workday will divide the assigned amount by the ~employee’s~ FTE for 100% FTE calculations.

Salary_Use_Assigned_Value_in_100_Percent.description: If not selected, Workday will divide the assigned amount by the ~employee’s~ FTE for 100% FTE calculations.

Stock_Plan_Unit_Grant_Split_Replacement_.description: Default Grant Split for the Stock Plan.

Stock_Plan_Unit_Profile_Replacement_Data.description: Profile Data used to override defaults in Stock Plan.

Subject_to_Statutory_Minimum.description: This box being checked indicates that the given Merit Plan is eligible for a Statutory Increase

Target_Percent.description: Target Percent for the Stock Plan.

Target_Shares.description: Target expressed as number of shares.

Unit_No_Individual_Override.description: No Individual Override indicator prevents default values from being overridden for specific employees assigned to a Unit Salary Plan; if the value is True, then Per Unit Amount and Default Units are required.

Unit_of_Duration_Reference_Compensation_.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Unit_of_Duration_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Use_Matrix_As_Reference_Only.description: The "Use MIM as Reference Only" option is applicable only when Merit Increase Matrix is defined for the plan.

Use_Matrix_as_Reference_Only.description: When setting up the bonus process for the bonus plan, Workday displays the bonus pool based on the matrix side-by-side with the bonus pool, which reflects the budget from an executive level. You can then compare the two pools to figure out whether the money you've received to fund the bonus event can cover the published matrix requirements, or whether the guidelines exceed the allowed budget.

Use_Target_Currency.description: Flag to indicate that a grant stock will be in the currency on this amount based stock plan

Use_as_Reference_Only.description: Select if you do not want the stock process to use the compensation matrix to calculate pools, but display the ranges only for reference.

Weight.description: The total weight between all compensation matrices and scorecards must total 100 percent.

is_Dynamic_Calculated_Plan.description: Will create a Dynamic Calculated Plan if selected. Purely informational and cannot be used to change plan type once plans are created.

is_Event_Driven_Calculated_Plan.description: Will create an Event Driven Calculated Plan if selected. Purely informational and cannot be used to change plan type once plans are created.
